comments:
I opened a workspace previously created with 3.1.1 and executed an Ant build.  The build worked but an error occurred during the refresh.  Attempts to manually refresh the project product a similar error.

From the error log:
eclipse.buildId=I20060526-0010
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

Error
Tue May 30 11:31:35 MDT 2006
An internal error occurred during: "Refresh".

Move to Platform/Resources

Could you attach the .project file for the project that the builder is operating on?  From looking through the code, the NPE shouldn't happen, but may be happening if there is a linked resource definition in a .project that is somehow malformed.

Created an attachment (id=43361)
.project file

The project getting the error has two linked resources.
Is it consistently reproducible?  Does it still occur in later sessions?  I tried this with a workspace from 3.1 and opened in 3.2 RC6 and it opened and refresh with no problems.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Is it consistently reproducible?  Does it still occur in later sessions?  I
> tried this with a workspace from 3.1 and opened in 3.2 RC6 and it opened and
> refresh with no problems.
> 
It is consistently reproducible.  However, in looking at this further, it appears that 3.1 wasn't entirely correct in its behavior either -- it just didn't throw any errors to make me notice.

Here's the physical layout of the project:
c:\shared\CSA\BUILD  (folder used as the root of project "CSA")
c:\shared\CSA\src    (source folder added to project as a link)
c:\shared\CSA\data   (external folder not directly accessed by the project, but
                      is copied to the following location during the Ant build:)
c:\shared\CSA\BUILD\data (class folder added to project as a link)

The .project file shows the "data" resource at location "C:/shared/CSA/data".  Under 3.1, this nevertheless was correctly interpreted as "c:\shared\CSA\BUILD\data" as per the Properties window.  However, after an Ant build, it NEVER was refreshed.  I just hadn't noticed.

Version 3.2 seems to be more confused, however.  Under project properties' Library tab, it shows the CSA/data resource as missing.  I can remove it, but not add it back since the directory structure under logical project name "CSA" did not refresh.  

I then tried editing .project to remove the reference to the "data" resource.  I also removed CSA/data from the classpath.  A refresh of the project then yielded a different error:

*** Bug 145523 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I opened defect 145523.  Fwiw, I do not have any linked resources.  I do have an external builder configured.  It is an ant task that copies some class files.  That ant task executes fine when I do a build.  The only time I get this error is when I press the Team Synchronize button. 

I will attach my project file.

.project file 

.project file for project that causes this error when I synchronize my project

Hmm. I don't think I have any linked resources or external builders configured. Though I am using dependent projects...
*** Bug 149794 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The same kind of problem occurs when the project has linked resources and the workspace crashes. It happens in my RCP application (it is enough just to kill the application from task manager). The problem seems to be in the ".snap" file stored in the workspace. After deleting this file the problem is fixed.

*** Bug 161145 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 163032 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Has anybody seen this error in a 3.3 milestone build?  I added some code shortly after 3.2 that should have eliminated this.  If you can reproduce in a 3.3 M1, M2, or M3, can you attach a stack trace here?
*** Bug 164664 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Marking this as fixed, since nobody has reproduced the problem in 3.3 milestones. It looks like my fix addressed it.
Can you tell us what was fixed and if a backport to 3.2.2 is possible ?

> Can you tell us what was fixed and if a backport to 3.2.2 is possible ?

I just added a trivial null check at the location of the NPE. It is possible to backport to 3.2.2, but there are no further 3.2.x releases planned.
